name: Easy Tom Khem Recipe (Lao Braised Pork With Eggs)
description: Tom khem is a delicious Lao dish of braised pork belly and hard-boiled eggs, simmered in a sweet-salty sauce.

recipeInstructions.text: Caramelize the sugar. Over medium heat, sprinkle white sugar into your pan or pot. Let it melt and bubble up until golden. Give the pan a gentle swirl.
recipeInstructions.name: Caramelize the sugar. Over medium heat, sprinkle white sugar into your pan or pot. Let it melt and bubble up until golden. Give the pan a gentle swirl.

recipeInstructions.text: Add your slices of ginger and crushed garlic. Sizzle until they release their aroma, about 10 seconds.
recipeInstructions.name: Add your slices of ginger and crushed garlic. Sizzle until they release their aroma, about 10 seconds.

recipeInstructions.text: Toss in the pork belly. Sear until all sides are saucy.
recipeInstructions.name: Toss in the pork belly. Sear until all sides are saucy.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour in water, add salt, dark soy sauce, and oyster sauce. Close the lid.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour in water, add salt, dark soy sauce, and oyster sauce. Close the lid.

recipeInstructions.text: Once boiling, gently slide in the hard-boiled eggs, giving everything a good, gentle stir.
recipeInstructions.name: Once boiling, gently slide in the hard-boiled eggs, giving everything a good, gentle stir.

recipeInstructions.text: Close the lid, turn down the heat to a low simmer, and let everything meld and thicken for about 45 minutes. Serve immediately.
recipeInstructions.name: Close the lid, turn down the heat to a low simmer, and let everything meld and thicken for about 45 minutes. Serve immediately.

keywords: braised pork belly, lao braised pork, tom khem
